page.title: 13Village Hall,Sompting
page.content: { { VILLAGE HALL SOMPTING The Hall was built in 1889 by William Booth on orders from Henry Croth Esq, as a reading and recreation room for his "poorer neighbours".In 1950 the name was changed to the Village Hall.It is owned by the village.The hall is run by a Committee.Electricity was installed in 1949 and Sanitation in 1957.There is a main hall,a cloakroom,a kitchen and toilets.There is a shed outside which is used as a store room.Every weekday morning Sompting Nursery School meets from 9.00 to 12.00.Thirty-six children attend (31 children were therethe day we visited).It costs 80 pence a morning and the children are given a third of a pint of milk and a biscuit.The children are aged between 3 and 5 years.
